channel.title: Basic math question
channel.description:
Basically I've got a maths assignment, which I have finished except for the easy part.
It gives 2 samples of data, says one has errors, and has some questions revolving around the sample that has the 'best fit' of a normal distribution which I've done.
I am supposed to prove which sample has the best fit of a normal distribution, It's obvious which is which when you just look at it but I have to show it mathematically.
I hit up google and found that with a normal distribution, 68% is within 1 standard deviation of the average, 95% is within 2 SD's and 99.7% is within 3. I found how to calculate the standard deviation, tried it and it gave a bad answer so I'm probably doing it wrong.
I am supposed to prove it using curve expert (http://www.ebicom.net/~dhyams/cftp.htm) by showing 1,2 and 3 SD's, using something about showing intervals, and using a gaussian model and r^2 values with residuals.
I would appreciate some input as to how I can prove which is the best fit of a normal distribution.
